title: Georgia House - Day 26 (2026-03-03)
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia House session transcript:

**Overview**
The session featured a scripture reading and prayer by Pastor Darrell Summy, who provided words of wisdom to the House members on the importance of knowing and serving God wholeheartedly. The main legislative action was the introduction of HB 586.

**Key Actions**
**HB 586**: No description provided

**Bills Introduced (First Reading)**
- HB 586

**Notable Moments**
- Pastor Darrell Summy delivered a sermon emphasizing the importance of fully knowing and faithfully serving God, drawing from 1 Chronicles 28:9-10. He encouraged the lawmakers to have a personal, intimate relationship with God rather than just knowing about Him.

**Votes**
No recorded votes mentioned.

**Attendance**
A quorum was present, as all members reported to their seats for the morning roll call.

**Adjournment**
The time of adjournment and date of the next session were not provided in the transcript.

They are convening having arrived. All members of this House will please report to their assigned seats. All members of the House will please report to their seats. The clerk will ring the bell. All members of the House will please report to their seats. We're going to have the morning roll call. All members present will please vote green to signify their presence in the chamber. And the clerk will unlock the machines. All members voted. All members now voted. If so, the clerk will lock the machines. Doorkeepers will please close the doors and keep them closed. Good morning. Hope everybody is in a great mood today. What a beautiful day out there, huh? Sun shining. We will begin our day today with scripture reading and prayer by the chapel and after which we will pledge allegiance to the flag of our country. Our chapel in this morning will be introduced by the gentleman from the 149th House District Representative Robert Pruitt, representative Pruitt. Thank you, Mr. Speaker and good morning, friends. I come to you this morning and I'm privileged to introduce you my pastor, pastor Darrell Summy. Darrell is a native originally from Panama City Beach, Florida. He's been with the first Baptist Church Eastman with us for a little over 20 years now. But Darrell's wife, Leanne, they're with us outside there and his seven children are at home. But Darrell is a special kind of preacher. He still preaches that teaches the gospel that you and I know. But he's a little bit different from the standpoint of his target audience. So he has been faithful to the ministry of youth. So I've yet to hear anybody introduce a youth pastor here. So I bring to you a little bit different flavor of a pastor and he has done an amazing job with our youth in Dodge County. Well attended groups and has been a great faithful following from that. So without any ado, I'd like to introduce you to and welcome, please, Pastor Darrell Summy. Well, good morning. I want to begin by expressing deep gratitude to Speaker David Walston for the invitation to be here this morning and to my representative from District 149 Robert Pruitt for extending such a gracious welcome to me and to my family. It is truly an honor to stand before you here in this place on this day. I tell you the truth, I never thought I would have an opportunity like this in my life. And so thank you so much for that. Please accept greetings and well wishes from the good people of Dodge County, Georgia. And please accept the same from my brothers and sisters, the family of faith at Eastman First Bab Disturge. And although I was originally born in North Carolina and raised in Panama, I said before that I've lived in Georgia longer than anywhere else and Georgia has become my home and I am proud to say that. Thank you for each of you, for your service to the people of Georgia. Please know that I am praying that God would bless you, my lady, as you lead this great state. You know success in life often requires going through a certain process. That's true when it comes to filling out your taxes. That's true if you're defusing a bomb. That's true if you're raising children or building a house. It's true if you're baking your grandmother's cookies. You better follow her recipe especially if she's going to eat them. I'd like to share with you today from first Chronicles 28 because I believe success in this life requires following the correct process as well. And we're going to pick up in this narrative where Solomon is having his inauguration day. David is old, he's not going to be around much longer and he is passing the reins on to King Solomon. King Solomon was going to take the reins that day. And David knew this was going to be a hard task. It was going to be a difficult task for this young man to fulfill. And so he wanted to pass along some last minute truths, some words of wisdom that would help him to be a success. And I am convinced that the instructions he gives Solomon would benefit each and every one of us. They are foundational for success in politics, for success in ministry, for success in life, whatever arena you find yourself. And so let me read from first Chronicles chapter 28 verse 9 and 10. Scripture says this, as for you, my son Solomon, know the God of your father and serve him with a whole heart and a willing mind for the Lord searches all hearts and understands every intent of the thoughts. If you seek him, he will let you find him. But if you forsake him, he will reject you forever. Consider now for the Lord has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary, be courageous and act. Father, I thank you that your word is truth and you have given us your word that we might not just have information but we might have transformation. And so I pray now that you would give me grace to preach, give us grace to hear and give us grace to apply these words to our lives and Jesus, name my prayer. So what is this process for success that we can find in these scriptures? Number one is to fully know God. King David said, know the God of your father. David wanted Solomon to know God. He didn't want Solomon to simply know about him. He wanted Solomon to know him personally, deeply, truly. You can almost hear David saying, son, I want you to know my Jehovah God, the one who has been my shepherd, the one who has given me victory in battle, the one who has forgiven me and cleansed me of my sins. This God whom I have known, he can be known by you too. And that's what I want for you son. David knew that the task ahead was going to be way too much for Solomon to handle on his own. Solomon would need the Lord. You know what? The truth of the matter is we're the same way. All of us need the Lord. None of us were designed to live our lives apart from him. God created each and every one of us with the express purpose of knowing and being known by him. And even though our sins have cut us off from God, he made a way for us to be made right with him. The Scriptures teach that Jesus came and paid the price for our sins. He came, the God man who took on flesh. He lived the perfect life that you and I could not live. He died the sacrificial death that you and I deserve. And he rose again victorious over sin and death so that we can have a right relationship with God. First Peter 3 verse 18 says, for Christ also suffered once for sins, the righteous for the unrighteous that he might bring us to God. We had no way of getting to God on our own. The Scriptures teach, the bad news of Scripture, is that there's nothing we can do to change the fact that we are separate from God because of our sins. But the Scriptures also teach the good news is that it's not about what we do. It's about what Christ is already done. As David did with Solomon, I plead with you. If you do not already know the Lord, get to know him. Don't settle for just knowing about him. Know him personally and intimately through Jesus Christ the Lord. There's nothing more important. David knew that until Solomon got that right, he wouldn't get anything else. Right. And the same is true for us. You know in baseball, it doesn't matter how far you hit the ball, it doesn't matter how fast you run or how well you slide, or even how pretty you look doing any of it. If you don't touch first base, none of the rest of it counts. And the same is true with knowing God. That's first base in life. Until you've done that, nothing else matters. You're not going to make it home and you're not going to win without knowing him. So that's the first thing we need to know God. Number two, David says, you know what? Serve God faithfully. David tells him, serve him with a whole heart and a willing mind for the Lord searches all hearts and understands every intent of the thoughts. David didn't just want his son to know God. He wanted Solomon to put him first and to serve him faithfully. Did you notice that David doesn't tell his son to serve the people? Well, why not? Shouldn't he do that as a leader? Yes, of course. But David knew that the best way for Solomon to serve the people well was for him to serve God with a whole heart. And the same is true with you. If you will serve the Lord with all your heart, you can guarantee that you will serve your constituents well. David also tells him how to serve the Lord. He says to serve him with a whole heart. You know, we are often guilty of giving half-hearted treatment, half-hearted effort to some of the things we do in life. However, God deserves and God expects nothing less than our whole heart. There should be no aspects of our lives that aren't surrendered to the Lordship of Jesus Christ. He is either Lord of all, who he is not Lord at all. We must remember too that we can't fool God. We can't put on a mask. We can't do, go through the motions and fool God. Because God doesn't look at the outward appearance. He looks at the heart. He knows our every deed, our every word, our every thought, our every motive. You can't pull the wool over his eyes to make sure you serve the Lord with a whole heart. Number three, seek the Lord fiercely. David says if you seek him, he will let you find him. Know him, yes, serve him, yes. But don't stop there. Keep seeking more of him. We should seek to see him more clearly, to love him more dearly, to follow him more nearly every single day. You know, some things in this life are so good that you just can't get enough of him. Whether it's donuts, a football, or laughter, or vacations to the Bahamas, or barbecue, hallelujah, whatever it is, there's things that we just have an insatiable appetite for. So let me ask you, how can we settle for just some of God, for just a little bit of Jesus? He is so amazing, so wonderful, so delightful. He is our treasure so that we should never be satisfied with what we already have of him. We should always want more. We should constantly hunger to know him and follow him more and more and more. The good news is that when you seek him, truly seek him, you will be rewarded. You will find him. And when you find him, you'll find everything you need for this life. Don't stop seeking him. And finally, David tells him obey God fiercely. Verse 10, David continues by saying, consider now for the Lord has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary. Be courageous and act. God had great plans for Solomon. He had personally chosen Solomon to build his temple. Can you imagine being chosen as the one to build a house for God? What a great honor. But it was also a formidable undertaking. How was this young rookie of a king going to succeed at such an incredible job by simple obedience? See in the next verses that we didn't read, we see that David gave Solomon the plans for the temple, the plans that God had given to David. And by simply following God's words, step by step, Solomon could not fail. You know what? We've been given plans by God too. In the Bible, we have the very blue plants for life. Second Timothy 3, 16 and 17, all scripture is inspired or breathed out by God and profitable for teaching, for approval, for correction, for training and righteousness that the man of God might be thoroughly equipped for every good work. He hasn't left us to try to figure out life on our own. We can be equipped for success by simply living life according to his work. God desires to accomplish significant things through each of us. It might not be leading a country, but he wants to accomplish great, eternal kingdom things through each and every one of us. And so whatever he calls you to do, be courageous and act and act, step out in obedience without hesitation, without compromise and see what great things he will accomplish through you. David knew that Solomon did these four things. Solomon and the whole nation of Israel would be just fine. Knowing God fully, serving God faithfully, seeking God fiercely and obeying God fearlessly, that's our recipe for success as well. Let us pray together. Heavenly Father, I come to you with praise and honor and thanksgiving, I praise you for being the only true God, for being our creator, for being our sustainer, I praise you for being holy and righteous in all your ways. Thank you so much, Father, for saving my soul. I thank you for making yourself known for me to me. I thank you for rescuing me from myself, for transforming my life from the inside out. And I pray, Father, that you would forgive us for our sins both individually and corporately. I pray that your kindness would lead us to repentance and that you would heal our hearts, our homes, and heal our land. I thank you, Father, for this great state, for this great nation and the freedoms that we have as a people. I thank you for the men and women who stand before me today and the work that they do to represent the people of Georgia. I pray for these representatives, Father. I pray that you would draw each of them to know you personally through Jesus Christ our Lord. I pray that you would grant them wisdom from on high, that they might be able to discern what is good and right and best as they lead our state. Your Word says that righteousness exalts a nation, so I pray that they would walk in righteousness so that they might lead us down that good path. I pray that your Holy Spirit would guide them into all truth that they would abhor what is evil and that they would cling to what is good. I thank you for your Holy Word and I pray that we would know it. And I pray that these gentlemen and ladies would know it so that they might serve as a lamp unto their feet and a light unto their path. I pray that you would guard and protect them, especially from the evil one who seeks to steal and kill and destroy in our lives and in our society. Bless this, Father, bless them with your provision, with your protection and most of all your presence. May they know you, serve you, seek you and obey you so that they might have true success in this task that you have appointed them to. May your kingdom come, Father, and you will be done on earth in the United States of America, in the state of Georgia, in this legislative body and in our lives, even as it's always done in heaven. Be honored and be glorified in us. I pray in the name above all names, the name of Jesus Christ the Lord in them. I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America and to the Republic for which it stands, one nation, under God, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all. Thank you.
